column1: Great news!   This partnership will promote better flood control and environmental restoration practices in the Atchafalaya basin and complements our WRDA18 provision to update operations for the Old River Control Structure. https://t.co/oYJWQMmLJG

A $2.4 million CARES Act grant from @US_EDA has been awarded to @LEDLouisiana to develop a technical assistance program and support business attraction and retention efforts across the state in response to adverse economic impacts caused by COVID-19.  https://t.co/Xmg9FYtAZK
Read the full press release about the Aircraft Certification Reform and Accountability Act (H.R. 8408). (4/4) https://t.co/xCF2ioy8SV

We will continue to build on the success of this bipartisan effort and demonstrate that Americans’ confidence in air travel including future technologies is well-founded in an unmatched record of safety and reliability. (3/4)

Cooperation and partnership between airlines passengers policymakers government and industry experts have produced our world-leading track record of aviation safety - this legislation is a product of that same rich tradition. (2/4)

The US House passed our bill which aims to strengthen the FAA's certification process & improve the regulatory process.   The trust Americans have in air travel doesn’t happen by itself: It has to be earned confirmed & reinforced ongoingly.  (1/4) https://t.co/E1K55b8qgk https://t.co/9w6LTdOTuu
More background here: (2/2) https://t.co/JOYLzTHDc0

UPDATE: POTUS SIGNS NUTRIA BOUNTY BILL.  Nutria days are numbered.   With this swift action from POTUS the states will have the resources needed to fight back the invasive species that accelerate the destruction of coastal wetlands. (1/2)  https://t.co/fj5tkCURMc

A $6.3 MILLION investment for the Hospital Service District 1 of EBR Parish from USDA.  2nd largest awarded out of 256 1 of 6 above $30 million.  It'll renovate & expand the hospital facility & capabilities & sustain jobs for 850 people in the area.  https://t.co/DoQxBzqngZ
More background here: (3/3) https://t.co/rhrfns1mJ2

Prior to the enactment of this legislation congressional offices were required to go through a cumbersome paperwork process that required constituents to physically sign permission forms before a federal agency could even be contacted. (2/3)

Signed by POTUS the CASES Act allows constituents to give their permission online for a member of Congress to work with a federal agency on their behalf.   I introduced the bill with @RepJoeKennedy & the US House has now launched the digital consent form. https://t.co/YwyoAmDIKM

We are also leading the national effort to modernize permitting.   Louisiana's coastal restoration projects transportation projects & energy infrastructure priorities would stand to benefit if fast tracked – stimulating economic development & jobs. (3/3) https://t.co/1SPCDi456d

The FAST included many provisions designed to address LA's traffic problems & had substantial increases in federal highway funding.   More here about surface transportation legislation & projects in Louisiana that have become a reality: (2/3) https://t.co/0f7LsiBXkF

The I-10 widening project is nearing final steps between EBR and Ascension parishes and it:  - Widens I-10 from 4 to 6 lanes - Saves up to 15 minutes of travel - Made possible with extra dollars through the FAST Act  More here: (1/3) https://t.co/iSZ6omRuM3
👀 ... and no fishing from the stairs https://t.co/weJx6JLg7F
Full statement below: (3/3) https://t.co/vqwZBN3KTL

The bill conveniently introduced two weeks before Election Day builds on top of attempts this year to eradicate offshore energy production while the same folks have simultaneously passed legislation to steer offshore revenues to the same states that oppose production. (2/3)

The Blue New Deal disguises knee-capping offshore energy production in the name of reforming federal ocean management.   The bill would improve jobs energy markets & inject billions of dollars in economic activity in Russia Saudi Arabia & China. (1/3)  https://t.co/uFwzVJBnKa

I introduced the BUILDER Act & look forward to working alongside colleagues such as @RepNewhouse to cut red tape and rebuild our country. (1/3) https://t.co/jLMIPgsuii

Introduced bipartisan legislation today with @RepKatiePorter to better protect Louisiana against natural disasters save lives & improve our resiliency.   Legislation comes as LA faces a sixth named storm Hurricane Delta this hurricane season  More here: https://t.co/dPLx8yJawk

The more we build upon the successes of the Rigs-to-Reef program the longer it keeps Louisiana a top competitor in the energy and fishing industries both of which power our local economies across South Louisiana.  More from BSEE here: https://t.co/HaGlNI73zs

Turning decommissioned offshore platforms like the Lena platform into thriving reef environments is a game changer for the preservation of different species — elevating the fishing industry and the important economic activity that comes with it.

BSEE has approved the conversion of ExxonMobil’s Lena platform into an artificial reef under the bureau’s Rigs-to-Reefs Program which creates a solution out of a problem & delivers a sustainable win-win for the Gulf ecosystem & the sportfishing economy.  https://t.co/hCsBD2whKl
More here from @OMSAmaritime :  https://t.co/vC7LodiieB

Announced the execution of a long-term charter agreement for the provision of the first-ever U.S. flagged “Jones Act” compliant Service Operations Vessel.   More info on the efforts from @edisonchouest @OrstedUS and @EversourceCorp is below:   https://t.co/pijZBmyO8A
Click below for the full press release: (3/3)  https://t.co/4hn1dDZMtA

This important management tool addresses the use of descending devices to release reef fish in the Gulf of Mexico at a depth sufficient for the fish to be able to recover from effects after changing water pressure levels (barotrauma). (2/3)

Major win for gulf anglers! DESCEND Act bipartisan legislation cosponsored with @RepHuffman passes US House.  Expands red snapper fishing stocks & fishing opportunities by helping to improve the survivability of the estimated 500k fish caught out of season or over limits: (1/3) https://t.co/XdDVfI7yVA

Under current law airports are unable to use AIP funds to incentivize early completion of airport projects even if the early completion would result in significant capacity or efficiency gains for the airport. (3/3)

It aims to allow airports to use up to $1 million in AIP funds to incentivize early completion of projects through grants to public agencies & other entities.  More on this legislation can be found in the full release here:  https://t.co/FvznJR3EbB

Bill to expedite airport infrastructure projects passes U.S. House!  By incentivizing early completion of airport projects this legislation will help ensure that airports have the tools necessary to avoid delayed service & get airport improvement projects completed faster. (1/3) https://t.co/OTI8j2HTSO

Last week we secured an amendment in the WRDA bill addressing the dead zone.   It would ensure the coastal & tidal waters of Louisiana are included in a program to detect treat & ultimately eliminate the Gulf of Mexico dead zone caused by runoff from other states. https://t.co/n6a8vSsSXj

Big wins for Louisiana.   Projects range from the construction of both the Houma Navigation Canal & a deepening project to enhance access to Port Fourchon & Bayou Lafourche — to a program that aims to detect treat & eliminate the Gulf of Mexico dead zone. We will continue working with Louisiana Transportation Secretary Shawn Wilson and federal officials to continue providing traffic solutions for our community.

Additionally this applies to a new bridge crossing the Mississippi River south of the “new bridge.” The recent $135 million grant announced for LA 1 between Leeville & Golden Meadow had a “High Priority Corridor” designation.   https://t.co/OSUuYhEIbF

The designation applies to I-10 (from Hwy 415 in Port Allen to the I-10/12 split) Highway 415 from I-10 to Highway 190 Highway 190 to I-110 LA Highway 1 from I-10 to White Castle LA Highway 30 from downtown Baton Rouge to the intersection of I-10 near Tanger mall in Gonzales.

The US House approved our amendment to designate critical roadways in the Capital Region as a High Priority Corridor on the National Highway System.    This puts us in better positioning for multi-billion grant programs to address our traffic problems plaguing our region.

Big thanks to Chairman Adam Smith Ranking Member Mac Thornberry Congresswoman Liz Cheney and other leaders for working together to do what is right for our national security and our military men and women. https://t.co/6Ko6ymTaZQ

Good meeting with Interior Secretary Bernhardt and Louisiana’s delegation members to discuss more aggressive action needed to protect the future of offshore energy in Louisiana. https://t.co/aBJLbP18sy

We’ve got to come up with solutions as PPP comes to a close and unemployment benefits end. The bills done so far have bought us time but we need to now focus on long term recovery. We are going to have to tailor future relief to present circumstances to help our economy recover. https://t.co/OcxbUyFx4R

Great news - this loan to @DemcoLouisiana is the third largest of its kind in the US & the only one granted in Louisiana.   11368 residents in St. Helena Livingston West Feliciana East Feliciana East Baton Rouge Tangipahoa and Ascension parishes will benefit. https://t.co/BMoSMMgFzW
We will be working with Cong. Richmond Scalise Abraham Higgins and Johnson to fix this injustice. (7/7)  #GAOA #LWCF #lalege

Third the bill funds additional property acquisition when the government has a backlog of over $10 billion in maintenance needs on existing properties. This bill is a failure and it should not have passed the Senate. (6/7)
Second the bill is supposed to be addressing “conservation” yet it fails one of the nation’s most important conservation crisis — the loss of coastal Louisiana our communities & ecosystem. (5/7)
